title: Metric Conversion
text: running xds_scaling, outputs xds_obj$outputs$scaling stored values EIR PR. function xde_pr2eir() uses linear interpolation.

title: Metric Conversion
text: algorithms require outputs xds_scaling  can create 50 randomly chosen values PfPR, output associated PfEIR values function flags values outside acceptable range. may seem important SIS model, range models can bounded, don’t want return nonsense values. can plot others:
code: library(ramp.xds) library(ramp.work) Spar  <- makepar_F_sin(bottom = 0.2, pw=2) model <- xds_setup_eir(eir = 1/365, season_par = Spar) model <- xds_scaling(model) clrs <- viridisLite::turbo(length(model$scaling$eir)) xds_plot_eirpr(model, clrs=clrs) add_eirpr_orbits(c(8, 12, 16,20), model, clrs=clrs) prs = c(0.001, runif(25, 0, 1), 0.999) preir_i = xds_pr2eir(prs, model) preir_i$errors ##       pr1       pr2       pr3  ## 0.0010000 0.9805397 0.9990000 xds_plot_eirpr(model) with(model$scaling, points(aeir, pr, pch = 15)) with(preir_i, points(365*eir, pr, pch = 19, col = "red"))

title: Scaling
text: Suppose defined model family: modify single parameter changes mean intensity exposure transmission, leave rest parameters fixed. study relationship exposure malaria outcomes, might vary mean annual EIR. study relationship mosquito density outcomes, might vary average annual emergence rate. \(\Lambda.\) compute scaling relationships systems seasonal forcing pattern, need compute stable orbits link outputs average annual values. function xds_scaling handles task. create mesh values mean forcing, either mean daily EIR, \(\bar E.\) mean daily emergence rate adult mosquitoes, \(\bar \Lambda\) Lambda. mesh value: compute store stable orbits important terms compute store mean values stable orbits

title: Scaling
text: Load required packages: Set model forced EIR seasonal pattern, use ramp.xds::show_season see pattern:  function xds_scaling computes stores values: xds_scaling$scaling stores average annual values name xds_scaling$scaling$stable_orbits stores stable orbits plot_eirpr plot PfPR function average annual PfEIR semi-log plot. function add_eirpr_orbits adds stable orbits indexed subset. use virisLite::turbo color scheme easy relate orbit mean value.
code: library(ramp.xds) library(ramp.work) Spar  <- makepar_F_sin(bottom = 0.2, pw=2) model <- xds_setup_eir(eir = 1/365, season_par = Spar) model <- xds_solve(model) show_season(model) xds_scaling(model) -> model names(model$scaling) ## [1] "aeir"          "eir"           "pr"            "ni"            ## [5] "stable_orbits" library(viridisLite) xds_plot_eirpr(model) ix_subset = c(9, 13, 17, 21) add_eirpr_orbits(ix_subset, model, clrs = turbo(25))

title: Scaling
text: xds_scaling dispatches xds_obj$forced_by, set either xds_setup_eir make_L_obj_trivial. function xds_scaling.eir() creates mesh logged values even mesh values log(aEIR) running \(10^{-2}\) \(10^{3}.\) function xds_scaling.Lambda() computes creates crude mesh. first step compute approximate pseudo-threshold value \(L.\) initial mesh looks five values \(c(L/100, L/5, L, 5L, 100L).\) Subsequent values identified picking new value interval largest change PfPR. adding new value,

Smith and Juliet Nsumba Nakakawa and Doreen Mbabazi Ssebuliba},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0-0},   url = {https://dd-harp.github.io/ramp.work/}, }

title: Algorithms to support workflows and analytics pipelines for RAMP (Robust Analytics for Malaria Policy)
text: ramp.work algorithm code library extends ramp.xds. install latest version ramp.xds GitHub, run following lines code R session. install latest version ramp.work Github, run following line R session:

title: Algorithms to support workflows and analytics pipelines for RAMP (Robust Analytics for Malaria Policy)
text: RAMP – Robust Analytics Malaria Policy – bespoke inferential system malaria decision support adaptive malaria control. core goal RAMP characterize, quantify, propagate uncertainty conventional analysis simulation-based analytics.

title: Algorithms to support workflows and analytics pipelines for RAMP (Robust Analytics for Malaria Policy)
text: ramp.xds R software package supports nimble model building simulation-based analytics malaria research. designed help research scientists policy analysts set , analyze, solve, apply dynamical systems models describing epidemiology, spatial transmission dynamics, control malaria mosquito-transmitted pathogens. software also supports nimble model building analysis mosquito ecology, capability handle forcing weather exogenous variables. software designed around rigorous mathematical framework modular model building, described Spatial Dynamics Malaria Transmission (Wu SL, et al. 2023. PLoS Computational Biology)1. mathematical framework now extended cover exogenous forcing weather vector control.

title: Algorithms to support workflows and analytics pipelines for RAMP (Robust Analytics for Malaria Policy)
text: ramp.work code library algorithms various work tasks ramp.xds. part suite R packages developed support RAMP: ramp.xds. core computational engine simulation-based analytics. includes basic set models – enough design, verify, demonstrate basic features modular software. ramp.library extended library stable code tested verified. includes large set model families published peer review included ramp.xds ability reuse code reduces costs replicating studies. library, ramp.xds also supports nimble model building analytics mosquito-borne pathogens. ramp.work includes algorithms apply framework, include code fit models data constrained optimization ramp.malaria includes large set models illustrating capabilities ramp.xds ramp.work active development.

title: Fit mean forcing — fit_mean_forcing
text: Fit mean forcing parameter. Functions called fit_mean_forcing dispatch class(xds_obj$forced_by) eir updates mean daily EIR Lambda updates mean daily emergence rate method designed fitting model observed values PfPR time series, \(x_t.\)

what: Fit a model to data — fit_model
title: Fit a model to data — fit_model
text: function fit multiple feature model time. feature model fit passed text strings list, called feature. feature, fit_model can configured fit parameters lump parameters together (e.g. IRS rounds use pesticide). feature sets default indexing subset parameters fit, can overridden passing text strings options. length(feature) == 1 another fit_ function ramp.work equivalent fit_model parameter constraints indexing options described greater detail. linked bullet points . length(feature) > 1 class(feature)= "multifit" feature list gets handled separately. function acts following text strings feature: mean_forcing : fits mean forcing parameter (also, see fit_mean_forcing) trend : fits interpolation points spline function (also, see fit_trend) default, \(y\) values interpolation points fitted subset can configured setting trend_ix options trend  mean_forcing called, least one interpolation points set 1 one following aspects seasonality: phase : time year forcing peaks (also, see fit_season_phase) pw : shape parameter affecting amplitude (also, see fit_season_pw) bottom : shape parameter affecting amplitude (also, see fit_season_bottom) amplitude : fits shape parameters affect amplitude: pw & bottom (also, see fit_season_amplitude) season : fits seasonality shape parameters: pw & bottom & phase (also, see fit_season) irs_coverage : fit irs coverage parameters (also see fit_irs_contact) default, coverage levels rounds fitted independently options can fitted setting irs_ix options bednet_contact : fit bed net coverage parameters (also see fit_bednet_contact) default, coverage levels rounds fitted independently options can fitted setting bednet_ix options xds model object gets returned fit_model optimal paramters.

title: Parasite dispersal by humans — make_HTC_matrix
text: Compute p p matrix \(\mathcal{D}\) whose columns describe potentially infectious person time persons patch dispersed across patches. $$\mathcal{D} = \mbox{diag}\left(W \right) \cdot \beta^T \cdot \mbox{diag}\left(bDH\right) \cdot \beta$$

title: Parasite dispersal by humans — make_HTC_matrix
text: W ambient human population patch beta biting distribution matrix b transmission efficiency mosquitoes humans D human transmitting capacity H human population size strata

title: Parasite dispersal by mosquitoes — make_VC_matrix
text: Compute p p matrix \(\mathcal{V}\) whose columns describe infective bites arising mosquitoes biting single human single day dispersed patches, accounting movement mortality. $$\mathcal{V} = fq\Omega^{-1} \cdot e^{-\Omega\tau} \cdot \mbox{diag}\left(\frac{fqM}{W}\right)$$

title: Parasite dispersal by mosquitoes — make_VC_matrix
code: make_VC_matrix(f, q, Omega, tau, M, W)

title: Parasite dispersal by mosquitoes — make_VC_matrix
text: f feeding rate q fraction bloodmeals taken humans Omega mosquito demography matrix tau duration extrinsic incubation period M size mosquito population patch W ambient human population patch

what: Parasite Dispersal through one Parasite Generation (Humans) — make_calR
title: Parasite Dispersal through one Parasite Generation (Humans) — make_calR
text: Computes n n matrix describing parasite dispersal infecteds (columns) infectees (rows). $$\mathcal{R} =   b \beta \cdot {\cal V}  \cdot \mbox{diag}\left(W \right) \cdot \beta^T  \cdot \mbox{diag}\left(DH\right)$$

title: Parasite Dispersal through one Parasite Generation (Humans) — make_calR
code: make_calR(b, beta, VC_matrix, W, D, H)

title: Parasite Dispersal through one Parasite Generation (Humans) — make_calR
text: b transmission efficiency mosquitoes humans beta biting distribution matrix VC_matrix parasite dispersal mosquitoes matrix (see make_VC_matrix) W ambient human population patch D human transmitting capacity H human population size strata

title: Parasite Dispersal through one Parasite Generation (Humans) — make_calR

what: Parasite Dispersal through one Parasite Generation (Mosquitoes) — make_calZ
title: Parasite Dispersal through one Parasite Generation (Mosquitoes) — make_calZ
text: Computes p p matrix describing parasite dispersal infecteds (columns) infectees (rows). $$\mathcal{Z} = e^{-\Omega\tau} \cdot \mbox{diag}\left( \frac{fq M}{W} \right) \cdot {\cal D} \cdot  fq\Omega^{-1}$$

title: Parasite Dispersal through one Parasite Generation (Mosquitoes) — make_calZ
code: make_calZ(Omega, tau, f, q, M, W, HTC_matrix)

title: Parasite Dispersal through one Parasite Generation (Mosquitoes) — make_calZ
text: Omega mosquito demography matrix tau duration extrinsic incubation period f feeding rate q fraction bloodmeals taken humans M size mosquito population patch W ambient human population patch HTC_matrix parasite dispersal humans matrix (see make_HTC_matrix)

title: Parasite Dispersal through one Parasite Generation (Mosquitoes) — make_calZ
